title: MF Voice Line Experimentation
body:
So in light of the recent Miss Fortune VO threads, I did a bit of experimental writing so see if I could hit the right mix of flirty, dangerous, sexy, and in control. This version of Miss Fortune is a leader solidifying her grip to power, disdainful of her enemies, prone to a bit of playful mockery, yet flirtatious (sometimes even playful) and not afraid to reach out to potential allies -- even if it means playing friends against each other.

This is by no means a complete concept, but I'm curious to see if people think this direction captures both aspects of Miss Fortune well enough that it might be worth exploring further.

**Illaoi (First Interaction)**
*-- What did Gangplank do for you that I can't do better?*
*-- You're right, Illaoi. There's a new queen in Bilgewater, and change* is *good*.
*-- I hope you're over him, priestess. Bilgewater is.*
*-- I warn you, priestess: I don't break easily.*

**Twisted Fate (First Interaction)**
*-- Twisted Fate, you sly dog. How much of Gangplank’s booty did you get away with?*
*-- You cut a dashing figure for a card shark. We should...play.*
*-- Come on, Fate. I could use a right-hand man, and you know you can do better than Graves.*
*-- You’ve always sought Fortune, Fate. Here I am. Feeling lucky?*

**Graves (First Interaction)**
*-- Come on, Malcolm. I could use a right-hand man, and you know you can do better than Fate.*
*-- Gangplank scorned you, but I know value when I see it.*
*-- Cross me at your own risk, outlaw. I’m faster on the trigger than you think.*
*-- Don’t run afoul of fortune in your quest for it, Graves.*

**Gangplank (First Interaction)**
*-- Not a soul mourned you, dog.*
*-- I hear the sharks have had a taste of your flesh, captain. Shall we give them the rest?*
*-- An iron fist, Gangplank? How tediously cliche. You never were one for subtlety.*
*-- Well look what the wharf rats dragged in.*
*-- I'll put a bullet in your skull next time, Gangplank.*
*-- Not even death wanted you, I see.*

**Firing *Double Up***
*-- Bang*
*-- Catch*
*--* \**kissing noise*\*

***Double Up*** **Champion Bounce**
*These lines are mostly mocking, sardonic lines. MF is playing around here.*

*-- Like fish in a barrel.*
*-- Gotcha.*
*-- Kaboom.*
*-- Should have dodged.*
*-- Too easy*

**Critical Hit with Double Up or kill with bounce**
*These lines are much more serious, even when identical to the lines above.*

*-- Should have dodged.*
*-- To easy.*
*-- Bullseye.*
*-- Right betwixt the eyes.*

**Kill**
*-- Dead already?*
*-- And down he/she/it goes.*
*-- Shame. I liked you.*
*-- Anyone else?*
*-- Like an anchor.*

[](https://i.imgur.com/DkCgpE5.jpg)

replies.body:
> -- Come on, Fate. **I could use a right-hand man**, and you know you can do better than Graves.

Oh I _know_ you didn't just backhandedly diss Rafen.

> Oh I _know_ you didn't just backhandedly diss Rafen.

Who?

Seriously. As some one who read the whole bilgwater story I have to ask. Who is Rafen and what does he matter?

> [{quoted}](name=A Frisky Jacket,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=RfpZY7ZB,comment-id=00040001,timestamp=2018-10-16T06:45:42.238+0000)
>
> Who?
> 
> Seriously. As some one who read the whole bilgwater story I have to ask. Who is Rafen and what does he matter?

Rafen is miss fortunes right hand man. He was in burning tides and shadow and fortune.

> Who?
> 
> Seriously. As some one who read the whole bilgwater story I have to ask. Who is Rafen and what does he matter?

I dunno how you missed him in Shadow and Fortune, but this quote gives a good explanation at who he is: 
> “What are you doing?” asked Rafen.
> 
> “What does it look like I’m doing?”
> 
> “Like you’re about to do something damned stupid.”
> 
> “Stupid?” said Miss Fortune, placing her hands on the table. “We shed blood and lost good people to bring down Gangplank. I’m not going to let the Harrowing just-”
> 
> “Just what?”
> 
> “Take this place from me,” she snapped lifting her pistols and jamming them into their custom tooled hip-scabbards. “And you’re not going to stop me.”
> 
> “We’re not here to stop you.”
> 
> Miss Fortune turned to see Rafen at the threshold of her chambers. A score of her best fighters waited in the vestibule beyond, armed to the teeth with a mixture of muskets, wheel-lock pistols, clanking bundles of clay splinter-bombs and cutlasses that looked like they’d been looted from a museum.
> 
> “Looks like you’re about to do something damned stupid as well,” she said.
> 
> “Aye,” agreed Rafen, walking over to the open window and slamming the shutters closed. “You really think we’d let our captain go out to face that alone?”
> 
> “I almost died bringing Gangplank down, and I’m not done yet. I don’t expect you to go with me, not tonight,” said Miss Fortune coming to stand before her men and resting her hands on the carved walnut grips of her guns. “This isn’t your fight.”
> 
> “Course it bloody is,” said Rafen.
> 
> Miss Fortune took a breath and nodded.
> 
> “There’s every chance we won’t live to see morning,” she said, unable to keep the hint of a smile tugging at her lip.
> 
> “This ain’t our first Harrowing together, Captain,” said Rafen, tapping the skull pommel of his sword. “And I’ll be damned if it’s our last.”

Nope. Still don't have a damn clue who Rafen is. I know MF has a crew that just kinda follows her around and does whatever she wants cause they're her minions and one of them has a name but yea. Who's Rafen?

> [{quoted}](name=Bioluminescence,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=RfpZY7ZB,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2018-10-16T01:40:32.111+0000)Oh I _know_ you didn't just backhandedly diss Rafen.

I guess the question you need to ask (well, in this version -- you know more of her canon than I do) is this: how much *does* Miss Fortune sweet-talk? If she's willing to tell Graves he's better than TF and vice versa, can you take that backhand diss fully at face value? Is it just a selling point, part of a grander plot, or something else? How many people really know *exactly* where they stand with her? :P

(I actually would love to know more about Rafen, frankly. From what we've seen we know he's important, but -- unless I missed it -- not really where his *exact* role is in Miss Fortune's "organization")

> [{quoted}](name=Bioluminescence,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=RfpZY7ZB,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2018-10-16T01:40:32.111+0000)
>
> Oh I _know_ you didn't just backhandedly diss Rafen.

New champion? xd

Screw the downvoters. I really, really like this. It's similar to GGMF, only better. And wordier, I suppose. How about some lines for activating Strut, or for using Make it Rain? Of course Bullet Time is just that iconic laugh.

> [{quoted}](name=KestrelGirl,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=RfpZY7ZB,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-10-16T00:56:45.308+0000)How about some lines for activating Strut, or for using Make it Rain? Of course Bullet Time is just that iconic laugh.

I had thought about those, but decided to avoid them for the moment in favor of more character-focused lines. Abilities are best for snappy one-liners due to the short time frame, and I wanted to start by having some room to explore the character more in depth.

How about "Stop looking at my boobs/ass and play the game you man-thot", I know that's needed for a lot of people and if I played her it would probably be needed for me too

{{sticker:sg-poppy}}

> [{quoted}](name=Get Ogre Here,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=RfpZY7ZB,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-10-16T00:37:40.561+0000)How about "Stop looking at my boobs/ass and play the game you man-thot", I know that's needed for a lot of people and if I played her it would probably be needed for me too

That's fair, but the goal is to move away from "fourth-wall-aware stripper fantasy" and into "flirtatious pirate queen." :P

This is pretty good. Some lines are a bit generic but for MF, i wouldn't expect her to be super eloquent.

Well done.

> [{quoted}](name=LightTrack,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=RfpZY7ZB,comment-id=000c,timestamp=2018-10-16T13:25:22.832+0000)
>
> This is pretty good. Some lines are a bit generic but for MF, i wouldn't expect her to be super eloquent.

Which ones feel generic? This is definitely just the start of a first draft, so I'd love to know where it can be improved!

Mainly the ones which feel like she is trying to sound badass on purpose or just showing her high self-esteem like Syndra is somehow related to her.

> -- I'll put a bullet in your skull next time, Gangplank.

Next time? This is 'next time' and the line is basically "I'm going to kill you!" Wew..

> An iron fist, Gangplank? How tediously cliche. You never were one for subtlety.

"You were never one for subtetly" is a line i keep hearing in so many works, it's ironically not subtle at all.

> -- You’ve always sought Fortune, Fate. Here I am. Feeling lucky?

Pun overload. It becomes cheesy halfway through but i like what you were going for.

> -- I warn you, priestess: I don't break easily.

"I'm tough, biatch. Take that as a warning." The condescending arrogance is...not very interesting to listen to because of how simply she puts it. It basically means "I'm badass so watch out."

{{champion:113}} "Deeds, not words."

I am not trying to downplay your writing, just giving criticism as objectively as i can.

If i were to write lines for her a few examples would be like this:

First encounter {{champion:111}} 

{{champion:21}} "Fate betrayed you. I know that feeling."

First encounter {{champion:555}} 

{{champion:21}} "You're in the way of my list."

First encounter: {{champion:420}} 

{{champion:21}} "Get in my way, and your god will be tested."

Upon killing {{champion:41}} 

{{champion:21}} "My mother would be proud."

Upon killing {{champion:4}} 

{{champion:21}} Out of luck. How ironic.

Upon killing {{champion:104}} 

{{champion:21}} "Graves..quick temper, slow mind."

> Next time? This is 'next time' and the line is basically "I'm going to kill you!" Wew..

True. It should be "this time." It IS supposed to be an "I'm going to kill you personally and make SURE it's DONE" line though -- GP did escape last time, after all.

> "You were never one for subtetly" is a line i keep hearing in so many works, it's ironically not subtle at all.

I don't think MF is necessarily concerned about being subtle -- it's a fairly direct reference to how much of a tyrant GP was, but it could probably use some revision.

> Pun overload. It becomes cheesy halfway through but i like what you were going for.

I actually didn't intend the "feeling lucky" pun there. I'll consider revising it.

> "I'm tough, biatch. Take that as a warning." The condescending arrogance is...not very interesting to listen to because of how simply she puts it. It basically means "I'm badass so watch out."

I should put more notes -- that's a half-flirty, half I'm-better-than-him line that references Illaoi's "Men. They break so easily" line.

Well i did not think of the Illaoi reference but yeah, i think MF needs some anger in her voice not just arrogance.

I mean when she pulls of kills or multikills, she can show off but when she sees an enemy like Kalista, she should respect the danger but reassure herself through the lines she speaks that she can do this.

Just my thoughts at least.

> [{quoted}](name=LightTrack,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=RfpZY7ZB,comment-id=000c0000000000000000,timestamp=2018-10-17T00:36:07.918+0000)
>
> Well i did not think of the Illaoi reference but yeah, i think MF needs some anger in her voice not just arrogance.
> 
> I mean when she pulls of kills or multikills, she can show off but when she sees an enemy like Kalista, she should respect the danger but reassure herself through the lines she speaks that she can do this.
> 
> Just my thoughts at least.

Totally fair. I don't personally see anger or need to reassure herself as much though. To me her anger seems heavily focused on Gangplank, and she seems confident enough and capable enough to orchestrate a rather complex rebellion and confident enough that, even in the knowledge that she might not survive, she goes through with it without a moment's hesitation.

To me that indicates confidence and, yes, a bit of arrogance. Not a lot, but enough to know that she's damn good at what she does, and that sometimes letting other people know that is better than having them try to challenge her.

I'm definitely going to have to reread her stories though. I only read through it twice before taking a look at this, and I think a few more reads would be helpful if I take another spin at it.

Sure but i was still talking in the context of someone like Kalista. As a person who lives in Bilgewater, she knows that the Harrowing is. She lived through at least one and should know what Kalista is.

Or seeing someone like Hecarim or Karthus even. Obviously, she'd have no interactions with Bard or Camille or someone like that but clearly her entire life doesn't literally revolve around GP.

> [{quoted}](name=LightTrack,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=RfpZY7ZB,comment-id=000c000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-10-17T01:34:46.789+0000)...but clearly her entire life doesn't literally revolve around GP.

Oh, certainly not. I just started with those because they were the easiest to draft up a few responses for. :)
I don't care too much. Just get rid of her slutty-like quotes

> [{quoted}](name=HungryAngry2SPP,realm=EUNE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=RfpZY7ZB,comment-id=000a,timestamp=2018-10-16T12:55:55.184+0000)
>
> I don't care too much. Just get rid of her slutty-like quotes

That's the plan. Flirtatious and possibly veering towards seduction (serious or planned as part of some larger game)? Sure. Slutty? Nah.
Dont change gun godess

> [{quoted}](name=AP MISS FORTUNE,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=RfpZY7ZB,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2018-10-16T02:52:30.913+0000)
>
> Dont change gun godess

I don't think it needs it. :)
any special lines when she is Captain Fortune?

> [{quoted}](name=Goblin Ranger,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=RfpZY7ZB,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-10-16T01:02:50.682+0000)
>
> any special lines when she is Captain Fortune?

At the moment, no. It's a situation like this where I'm upset they didn't go with Classic Fortune and make Captain Fortune the base model -- frankly, if I was given free reign, I'd make that change and give Classic Fortune a few replacement lines that are more flirty or overtly sexy, so that players could opt-in to a different MF experience.

I don't want captain fortune to be the base. Classic Fortune is what MF wears when she isn't doing pirate things, she puts on her captain garb when she is doing work. 

Also, the player is first introduced to MF in that classic garb (they use it in her lore). Captain Fortune arose out of Burning Tides.

> [{quoted}](name=The Djinn,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=RfpZY7ZB,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2018-10-16T01:11:51.515+0000)
>
> At the moment, no. It's a situation like this where I'm upset they didn't go with Classic Fortune and make Captain Fortune the base model -- frankly, if I was given free reign, I'd make that change and give Classic Fortune a few replacement lines that are more flirty or overtly sexy, so that players could opt-in to a different MF experience.

100% agree.

I think you did an awesome job mixing the different aspects of her character; my only issue is that some lines seem a little formal for a Bilgewater champion.  Using the word "betwixt", for example, seems like a strange choice.

The other line is for Illaoi.  "I warn you" should be "I'm warning you", for example; it's very similar, but it changes the tone immensely.  "I warn you" sounds much more controlled; it sounds like something Taliyah or Ashe might say, not Miss Fortune.  Miss Fortune having relatively loose language suits her "casual confidence" really well; she's in control, but not even-tempered, is the gist of my point.

> [{quoted}](name=Larriet,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=RfpZY7ZB,comment-id=0013,timestamp=2018-10-17T20:01:20.763+0000)I think you did an awesome job mixing the different aspects of her character; 

Thanks!

>my only issue is that some lines seem a little formal for a Bilgewater champion.  Using the word "betwixt", for example, seems like a strange choice.

Yep! That's already changed in the new draft. In fact, I've gone back and reread all the MF lore and videos and comics released up to this point, so the next version should capture her better than this one does. I've even started with a list of core concepts to MF's identity:

* Confident.
* Doesn’t harm the innocent willingly...although someone can be guilty by association.
* Faces fear with action.
* Prefers not to kill, but will without hesitation or mercy when necessary.
* Fears becoming Gangplank, especially when killing is needed or expedient.
* Confident.
* Flirtatious.
* Terse by default, especially when stressed.
* Loquacious when needed, but even then not prone to flowery language.
* Has a sense of humor.
* Does what is needed to accomplish her goals, even if brutal.
* Wants the best for Bilgewater and its people.
* Doesn’t fear death.
* Rises up in the face of opposition.
* Holds power partly for herself, but partly to prevent those less moral from holding it.
* Has a somewhat twisted sense of morality and honor, but those ARE still present.

> The other line is for Illaoi.  "I warn you" should be "I'm warning you", for example; it's very similar, but it changes the tone immensely.  "I warn you" sounds much more controlled; it sounds like something Taliyah or Ashe might say, not Miss Fortune.  Miss Fortune having relatively loose language suits her "casual confidence" really well; she's in control, but not even-tempered, is the gist of my point.

Totally get that, and it's a damn good observation. I'll make that change on the new draft.

It all depends on what she sounds like though. Good writing can't outplay poor voice over work or a poor choice in voice actors. While I don't mind the lines in the GGMF skin it didn't sound enough like MF to me, especially the laugh. They have got to nail that laugh.

On a side note:

If "Fortune doesn't favor fools." doesn't stay in there somewhere I'm flipping some tables.

> [{quoted}](name=EyesOfTheFox,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=RfpZY7ZB,comment-id=000f,timestamp=2018-10-16T18:45:16.983+0000)
>
> It all depends on what she sounds like though. Good writing can't outplay poor voice over work or a poor choice in voice actors. While I don't mind the lines in the GGMF skin it didn't sound enough like MF to me, especially the laugh. They have got to nail that laugh.

Oh, absolutely. The voice actor matters as much or more than the dialogue.
GGMF laugh is horrible, my supp mutes the game when I'm spamming it.

Personally I think everything here is pretty damn good

Though I also have the opinion that removing the sluttiness isn't really necessary, its not core to her character as much as being flirty/in-control but if she finds someone hot, her being a tease isn't necessarily a bad thing.  I think it's very bland on Eve just because she's so generic about it, there isn't enough specific interaction.  If MF expressed her own taste via champion interactions that'd be a way to have an element of that but make it feel personal to her, giving it some meaning.

> [{quoted}](name=TwitchInMyPants,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=RfpZY7ZB,comment-id=000e,timestamp=2018-10-16T18:02:54.636+0000)Personally I think everything here is pretty damn good

Thanks!

> Though I also have the opinion that removing the sluttiness isn't really necessary, its not core to her character as much as being flirty/in-control but if she finds someone hot, her being a tease isn't necessarily a bad thing. 

I tried to keep a bit of that teasing in. There's two lines in there for TF, and two for Illaoi, for example, that have a bit of that "Oooooh. I *like* this one" vibe to them.

> [{quoted}](name=Zephylion,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=RfpZY7ZB,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2018-10-16T10:14:24.576+0000)
>
> {{champion:21}} Maybe give her some sexual flirty lines like Evelynn? For example, give her a few lines when she hits a new target and gets her passive on them such as;
> "I like beginners~" or, "You would do...for now"
> {{sticker:sg-lux-2}} 
> Reading it again makes me wonder what I do in my free time. Then again MF is probably as sexualised as Eve excluding character lore and voice-lines.

Miss Fortunes lore was rewritten, and it says “surrounded herself with a small group of friends and lovers” so I don’t think she’s going around trying to fuck everything like everybody thinks.
She would still tease people, just not to Eve levels.  More like Ahri levels.
A audio is better ? :)

> [{quoted}](name=OTP RIVEN95800,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=RfpZY7ZB,comment-id=0012,timestamp=2018-10-17T16:30:45.801+0000)
>
> A audio is better ? :)

Agreed! But I don't think you want a deep-voiced male reading MF's lines, so I skipped it. :P
LOL okay ^_^
This is really cool! I hope you write more for interactions with champs outside of Bilgewater. I think some of those could be really interesting.

> [{quoted}](name=Baconor,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=RfpZY7ZB,comment-id=0010,timestamp=2018-10-17T05:31:01.840+0000)
>
> This is really cool! I hope you write more for interactions with champs outside of Bilgewater. I think some of those could be really interesting.

I'm working through the Shadow Isles now, and then plan to focus on some unique carry/support lines, as she'll run into those champions more often.
Please tell me the "Kaboom" on double up is a reference to the shooting minigame in Legend of Zelda, Windwaker.
